docs.title: PraisonAIUI
docs.text:
One YAML file, one docs folder, one command — ship a beautiful documentation site.

PraisonAIUI is a YAML-driven website generator that transforms a single configuration file and a docs folder into a modern, production-ready website.

docs.title: ✨ Features
docs.text:
• :material-file-document: YAML-Driven Configure your entire site with a single YAML file

  • :material-puzzle: Component Slots Flexible slot system for headers, sidebars, and content

  • :material-palette: Theming Dark mode, custom colors, and UI framework support

  • :material-rocket-launch: Hot Reload Instant rebuilds during development

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
PythonNode.js 
pip install praisonaiui
aiui init
aiui build

npm install praisonaiui
npx aiui init
npx aiui build

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
graph LR
    A[aiui.template.yaml] --> B[aiui build]
    C[docs/] --> B
    B --> D[ui-config.json]
    B --> E[docs-nav.json]
    B --> F[route-manifest.json]
    D --> G[Next.js App]
    E --> G
    F --> G

docs.title: init
docs.text:
Initialize a new project.

aiui init [OPTIONS]
Option Type Default Description --template, -t string minimal Template: minimal, docs, marketing --force, -f flag false Overwrite existing files

docs.title: validate
docs.text:
Validate configuration file.

aiui validate [OPTIONS]
Option Type Default Description --config, -c path aiui.template.yaml Config file path --strict flag false Strict validation mode

docs.title: build
docs.text:
Build manifests from configuration.

aiui build [OPTIONS]
Option Type Default Description --config, -c path aiui.template.yaml Config file path --output, -o path aiui Output directory --minify flag false Minify JSON output

docs.title: dev
docs.text:
Start development mode with file watching.

aiui dev [OPTIONS]
Option Type Default Description --config, -c path aiui.template.yaml Config file path --port, -p int 3000 Dev server port

docs.title: Direct Usage
docs.text:
from praisonaiui import Config
from praisonaiui.compiler import Compiler

# Load and validate config
config = Config.from_yaml("aiui.template.yaml")

# Build manifests
compiler = Compiler(config)
result = compiler.compile()

# Access outputs
print(result.ui_config)
print(result.docs_nav)
print(result.route_manifest)

docs.title: Config
docs.text:
Main configuration model.

from praisonaiui import Config

# From file
config = Config.from_yaml("aiui.template.yaml")

# From dict
config = Config(**{
    "schemaVersion": 1,
    "site": {"title": "My Site"},
    ...
})

docs.title: Compiler
docs.text:
Compile configuration to manifests.

from praisonaiui.compiler import Compiler

compiler = Compiler(config)
result = compiler.compile()

docs.title: DocsScanner
docs.text:
Scan docs directory for pages.

from praisonaiui.compiler import DocsScanner

scanner = DocsScanner(
    docs_dir=Path("./docs"),
    include=["**/*.md"],
    exclude=["**/drafts/**"]
)

pages = scanner.scan()
for page in pages:
    print(page.slug, page.title)

docs.text:
Build navigation tree.

from praisonaiui.compiler import NavBuilder

builder = NavBuilder(pages)
nav = builder.build()

docs.title: YAML Configuration
docs.text: Complete guide to the aiui.template.yaml configuration schema.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
PraisonAIUI uses a single YAML file to configure your entire site. This file defines:

  • Site metadata - Title, description, theme
  • Content sources - Where to find your docs
  • Components - Reusable UI elements
  • Templates - Page layouts with slots
  • Routes - URL patterns to template mappings

docs.title: Schema Version
docs.text:
Always specify the schema version:

schemaVersion: 1

docs.title: Site Configuration
docs.text:
site:
  title: "My Documentation"          # Required
  description: "Site description"    # Optional
  routeBaseDocs: "/docs"             # Default: /docs
  ui: "shadcn"                       # Theming hint (shadcn | mui | chakra)
  theme:
    preset: "zinc"                   # Any Tailwind color (22 options)
    radius: "md"                     # none | sm | md | lg | xl
    darkMode: true

Note: The ui field is a theming hint. Components are UI-agnostic and use CSS classes you can style with any framework.

docs.title: Component Dependencies
docs.text:
Auto-install shadcn components at build time:

dependencies:
  shadcn:
    - accordion
    - tabs
    - dialog

When you run aiui build, any missing components are automatically installed via npx shadcn add.

docs.title: Content Sources
docs.text:
content:
  docs:
    dir: "./docs"                    # Path to docs folder
    include:                         # Glob patterns
      - "**/*.md"
      - "**/*.mdx"
    exclude:                         # Excluded patterns
      - "**/drafts/**"
    indexFiles:
      - "index.md"
      - "README.md"
    nav:
      mode: "auto"                   # auto | manual
      sort: "filesystem"             # filesystem | alpha | date
      collapsible: true
      maxDepth: 4

docs.title: Components
docs.text:
Define reusable components:

components:
  my_header:
    type: "Header"
    props:
      logoText: "My Site"
      cta:
        label: "Get Started"
        href: "/docs"

  my_footer:
    type: "Footer"
    props:
      text: "© 2024"

docs.title: Built-in Component Types
docs.text: Type Description Header Site header with logo, nav, CTA Footer Site footer DocsSidebar Documentation sidebar navigation Toc Table of contents DocContent Rendered markdown content

docs.title: Templates
docs.text:
Templates combine a layout with slot assignments:

templates:
  docs:
    layout: "ThreeColumnLayout"
    slots:
      header: { ref: "my_header" }     # Reference a component
      left: { ref: "sidebar_docs" }
      main: { type: "DocContent" }     # Direct type assignment
      right: { type: "Toc" }
      footer: { ref: "my_footer" }

docs.title: Layouts
docs.text: Layout Description ThreeColumnLayout Sidebar + Content + TOC TwoColumnLayout Sidebar + Content CenteredLayout Centered content, no sidebar FullWidthLayout Full width content FlexibleLayout WordPress-style widget zones

docs.title: Widget Zones
docs.text:
Place widgets in layout zones without modifying markdown:

templates:
  docs:
    layout: "FlexibleLayout"
    zones:
      rightSidebar:
        - type: "Toc"
        - type: "StatsCard"
          props:
            title: "Users"
            value: "15,231"
            change: "+20%"
      footer:
        - type: "Newsletter"
        - type: "Copyright"
          props:
            text: "© 2024"

docs.title: Available Zones
docs.text: Zone Description header Top header topNav Below header nav hero Hero banners leftSidebar Left column main Main content rightSidebar Right column bottomNav Pagination area footer Footer widgets

docs.title: Built-in Widgets
docs.text:
Widget Description StatsCard Metrics display QuickLinks Navigation links Newsletter Email signup HeroBanner Hero section SocialLinks Social icons Copyright Copyright text

See Widget Zones for full documentation.

docs.title: Routes
docs.text:
Map URL patterns to templates:

routes:
  - match: "/docs/**"
    template: "docs"

  - match: "/docs/changelog"
    template: "docs"
    slots:
      right: null                      # Override: hide TOC

Route matching uses glob patterns: - * - Single segment - ** - Multiple segments

docs.title: Slots & Components
docs.text: Understanding the slot system and built-in components.

docs.title: Slot System
docs.text:
Slots are named insertion points in layouts. Each template assigns components to slots:

templates:
  docs:
    layout: "ThreeColumnLayout"
    slots:
      header: { ref: "main_header" }
      left: { type: "DocsSidebar" }
      main: { type: "DocContent" }
      right: { type: "Toc" }
      footer: { ref: "main_footer" }

docs.title: Header
docs.text:
Site header with logo, navigation, and CTA.

components:
  my_header:
    type: "Header"
    props:
      logoText: "My Site"
      logoHref: "/"
      links:
        - label: "Docs"
          href: "/docs"
        - label: "Blog"
          href: "/blog"
      cta:
        label: "Get Started"
        href: "/docs/quickstart"

docs.title: Footer
docs.text:
Site footer with links and copyright.

components:
  my_footer:

      links:
        - label: "GitHub"
          href: "https://github.com"

docs.title: Templates & Layouts
docs.text: Learn how templates and layouts work in PraisonAIUI.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Templates define the structure of your pages by combining: - A layout - The structural container - Slots - Pluggable content areas

docs.title: Layouts
docs.text:
PraisonAIUI provides four layouts:

Layout Description ThreeColumnLayout Sidebar + Content + TOC (classic docs) TwoColumnLayout Sidebar + Content (no TOC) CenteredLayout Centered content, no sidebar FullWidthLayout Full-width content

docs.title: Defining Templates
docs.text:
templates:
  docs:
    layout: "ThreeColumnLayout"
    slots:
      header: { ref: "my_header" }
      left: { ref: "sidebar" }
      main: { type: "DocContent" }
      right: { type: "Toc" }
      footer: { ref: "my_footer" }

docs.title: Slot Assignment
docs.text: Slots can be assigned in two ways:

docs.title: Reference (ref)
docs.text:
Point to a component defined in the components section: 

slots:
  header: { ref: "my_header" }

docs.title: Direct Type
docs.text:
Use a component type directly: 

slots:
  main: { type: "DocContent" }

docs.title: Null (hide)
docs.text:
Remove a slot entirely: 

slots:
  right: null

docs.title: Advanced Examples
docs.text: Complex configurations and customization patterns.

docs.title: Multiple Templates
docs.text:
Different layouts for different sections:

templates:
  docs:
    layout: "ThreeColumnLayout"
    slots:
      header: { ref: "header" }
      left: { type: "DocsSidebar" }
      main: { type: "DocContent" }
      right: { type: "Toc" }
      footer: { ref: "footer" }

  marketing:
    layout: "DefaultLayout"
    slots:
      header: { ref: "header" }
      hero: { type: "Hero" }
      main: { type: "PageContent" }
      footer: { ref: "footer" }

routes:
  - match: "/docs/**"
    template: "docs"

  - match: "/"
    template: "marketing"

  - match: "/pricing"
    template: "marketing"

docs.title: Route-Level Overrides
docs.text:
Override slots for specific pages:

routes:
  - match: "/docs/**"
    template: "docs"

  - match: "/docs/changelog"
    template: "docs"
    slots:
      right: null  # Hide TOC on changelog

  - match: "/docs/api/**"
    template: "docs"
    slots:
      left: { type: "ApiSidebar" }  # Different sidebar

docs.title: Custom Components
docs.text:
Register custom components in TypeScript:

// components/CustomHeader.tsx
import { SlotRegistry } from 'praisonaiui/runtime';

function CustomHeader({ logoText, links }) {
  return (
    <header className="custom-header">
      <h1>{logoText}</h1>
      <nav>
        {links.map(link => (
          <a key={link.href} href={link.href}>{link.label}</a>
        ))}
      </nav>
    </header>
  );
}

// Register to override default Header
SlotRegistry.register('Header', CustomHeader);

docs.title: Supported Fields
docs.text: Field Description title Page title (overrides heading) order Sort order in navigation hidden Hide from navigation description SEO meta description

docs.title: Numbered Prefixes
docs.text:
Files with numbered prefixes are auto-sorted:

docs/
├── 01-introduction.md   # order: 1
├── 02-installation.md   # order: 2
└── 03-quickstart.md     # order: 3

The prefix is stripped from the URL slug.

docs.title: Dark Mode
docs.text: Enable and customize dark mode for your site.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Enable dark mode in your configuration:

site:
  theme:
    darkMode: true

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
When darkMode: true, the runtime:

  1. Checks user's system preference (prefers-color-scheme)
  2. Adds a toggle button to the Header component
  3. Persists user preference in localStorage
  4. Applies data-theme="dark" to the HTML element

docs.title: CSS Variables
docs.text:
Override dark mode colors in your CSS:

[data-theme="dark"] {
  --md-default-bg-color: #0f172a;
  --md-default-fg-color: #f1f5f9;
  --md-primary-fg-color: #14B8A6;
}

docs.title: Manual Control
docs.text:
Control dark mode via the TypeScript SDK:

import { useTheme } from 'praisonaiui/runtime';

function ThemeToggle() {
  const { theme, setTheme } = useTheme();

  return (
    <button onClick={() => setTheme(theme === 'dark' ? 'light' : 'dark')}>
      Toggle Theme
    </button>
  );
}

docs.title: Automatic Detection
docs.text:
The runtime automatically detects system preference:

const prefersDark = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches;

docs.title: Hot Reload
docs.text: Instant rebuilds during development.

docs.title: Dev Mode
docs.text:
Start development mode with file watching:

aiui dev

docs.title: What Gets Watched
docs.text:
The dev server watches:

  • aiui.template.yaml - Configuration changes
  • docs/ - Content changes
  • Any configured content directories

docs.title: Rebuild Triggers
docs.text: Change Type Action Config change Full rebuild Doc added/removed Nav rebuild Doc content change Single page rebuild

docs.title: WebSocket Updates
docs.text:
The dev server uses WebSocket for instant updates:

⏳ Watching aiui.template.yaml for changes...
🔄 Config changed, rebuilding...
✅ Rebuilt in 45ms

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
aiui dev --port 3000    # Change port
aiui dev --no-open      # Don't open browser
aiui dev --verbose      # Show all events

docs.title: Integration with Next.js
docs.text:
When using Next.js development:

# Terminal 1: Watch aiui config
aiui dev

# Terminal 2: Run Next.js
npm run dev

Or use concurrently:

{
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "concurrently \"aiui dev\" \"next dev\""
  }
}

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text: Configure automatic and manual navigation generation.

docs.title: Auto Navigation
docs.text:
By default, navigation is generated from your docs folder structure:

content:
  docs:
    nav:
      mode: "auto"
      sort: "filesystem"

docs.title: Sort Options
docs.text: Mode Description filesystem Use file order on disk alpha Alphabetical by title date By creation date

docs.title: Navigation Tree
docs.text:
Generated navigation follows this format:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "title": "Getting Started",
      "slug": "getting-started",
      "children": [
        { "title": "Installation", "slug": "getting-started/installation" },
        { "title": "Quick Start", "slug": "getting-started/quickstart" }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Collapsible Sections
docs.text:
content:
  docs:
    nav:
      collapsible: true
      maxDepth: 4

docs.title: Manual Navigation
docs.text:
For full control, use manual mode:

content:
  docs:
    nav:
      mode: "manual"
      items:
        - title: "Home"
          href: "/docs"
        - title: "Guides"
          children:
            - title: "Installation"

docs.title: Dark Mode
docs.text:
Enable or disable dark mode:

site:
  theme:
    darkMode: true   # true | false

The frontend includes a ThemeToggle component for light/dark/system modes.

docs.title: Theme Toggle Component
docs.text:
Add a theme toggle to your header:

import { ThemeToggle } from '@praisonaiui/react'

function Header() {
  return (
    <header>
      <nav>...</nav>
      <ThemeToggle />
    </header>
  )
}

docs.title: Custom CSS Variables
docs.text:
Theme presets generate CSS variables you can override:

:root {
  --background: oklch(1 0 0);
  --foreground: oklch(0.141 0.005 285.823);
  --primary: oklch(0.21 0.006 285.885);
  --radius: 0.5rem;
}

docs.title: Advanced: Custom Frontend
docs.text:
For full customization, scaffold a React project:

aiui init --frontend
cd frontend
pnpm install
pnpm dev

docs.title: CLI Usage
docs.text: Complete reference for the aiui command-line interface.

docs.title: aiui init
docs.text:
Initialize a new PraisonAIUI project.

aiui init [OPTIONS]
Option Description Default --template, -t Template: minimal, docs, marketing minimal --force, -f Overwrite existing files false

Example: 

aiui init --template docs

docs.title: aiui validate
docs.text:
Validate your configuration file.

aiui validate [OPTIONS]
Option Description Default --config, -c Path to config file aiui.template.yaml --strict Enable strict validation false

Example: 

aiui validate --config my-config.yaml

docs.title: aiui build
docs.text:
Build manifests from configuration.

aiui build [OPTIONS]
Option Description Default --config, -c Path to config file aiui.template.yaml --output, -o Output directory aiui --minify Minify JSON output false

Example: 

aiui build --output dist/aiui --minify

docs.title: aiui dev
docs.text:
Start development mode with file watching.

aiui dev [OPTIONS]
Option Description Default --config, -c Path to config file aiui.template.yaml --port, -p Development server port 3000

Example: 

aiui dev --port 4000

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text: Code Meaning 0 Success 1 Configuration error 2 File not found 3 Build error

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable Description AIUI_CONFIG Default config file path AIUI_OUTPUT Default output directory

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Install PraisonAIUI to start building YAML-driven websites.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.9 or higher
  • Node.js 18+ (for TypeScript runtime)
  • Next.js 14+ (optional, for React components)

docs.title: Python Package (CLI)
docs.text:
pipuvpipx 
pip install aiui

uv pip install aiui

pipx install aiui

After installation, verify:

aiui --version
# praisonaiui version 0.1.0

docs.title: TypeScript Package (Runtime)
docs.text:
npmpnpmyarn 
npm install praisonaiui

pnpm add praisonaiui

yarn add praisonaiui

docs.title: Development Installation
docs.text:
For contributing or local development:

# Clone the repo
git clone https://github.com/MervinPraison/PraisonAIUI.git
cd PraisonAIUI

# Install Python package in dev mode
pip install -e .[dev]

# Install TypeScript package
cd src/praisonaiui-ts
pnpm install

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Create your first PraisonAIUI project in under 5 minutes.

docs.title: 1. Initialize a Project
docs.text:
aiui init

This creates: - aiui.template.yaml - Your site configuration - docs/ - Starter documentation folder

docs.title: 2. Explore the Configuration
docs.text:
# aiui.template.yaml
schemaVersion: 1

site:
  title: "My Documentation"
  description: "Built with PraisonAIUI"

content:
  docs:
    dir: "./docs"

templates:
  docs:
    layout: "ThreeColumnLayout"
    slots:
      header: { ref: "header_main" }
      left: { ref: "sidebar_docs" }
      main: { type: "DocContent" }
      footer: { ref: "footer_main" }

components:
  header_main:
    type: "Header"
    props:
      logoText: "My Docs"

  sidebar_docs:
    type: "DocsSidebar"
    props:
      source: "docs-nav"

  footer_main:
    type: "Footer"
    props:
      text: "© 2024"

routes:
  - match: "/docs/**"
    template: "docs"

docs.title: 3. Validate Configuration
docs.text:
aiui validate
# ✓ Configuration is valid

docs.title: 4. Build Manifests
docs.text:
aiui build

This generates: - aiui/ui-config.json - Site configuration - aiui/docs-nav.json - Navigation tree - aiui/route-manifest.json - Route mappings

docs.title: 5. Start Development
docs.text:
aiui dev
# ⏳ Watching aiui.template.yaml for changes...

import { createAIUI } from 'praisonaiui/runtime';

// Initialize runtime

});

  // next.config options
});

  return <DocsPage {...props} />;
}

docs.title: Runtime
docs.text: Core runtime utilities for the TypeScript SDK.

docs.title: createAIUI
docs.text:
Initialize the runtime:

import { createAIUI } from 'praisonaiui/runtime';

const aiui = createAIUI({
  manifestPath: './aiui',  // Path to manifests
  basePath: '/docs'        // Base path for docs
});

docs.title: resolveTemplate
docs.text:
Match a route to its template configuration:

import { resolveTemplate } from 'praisonaiui/runtime';

const template = resolveTemplate('/docs/getting-started', routeManifest);

console.log(template);
// {
//   layout: "ThreeColumnLayout",
//   slots: {
//     header: { ref: "main_header" },
//     main: { type: "DocContent" }
//   }
// }

docs.title: SlotRegistry
docs.text:
Register and retrieve slot components:

import { SlotRegistry } from 'praisonaiui/runtime';

// Register custom component
SlotRegistry.register('Header', MyCustomHeader);

// Get component
const HeaderComponent = SlotRegistry.get('Header');

// Check if registered
if (SlotRegistry.has('Footer')) {
  // ...
}

// Get all registered
const all = SlotRegistry.getAll();

docs.title: Manifest Loading
docs.text:
import { loadManifest } from 'praisonaiui/runtime';

const uiConfig = await loadManifest('ui-config.json');
const docsNav = await loadManifest('docs-nav.json');
const routes = await loadManifest('route-manifest.json');
